hook.text: Masked protesters smash windows. Would they do the same without the mask? Anonymity changes behavior.

buildup.text: Deindividuation is the loss of self-awareness and personal responsibility in crowds or anonymous settings.

discovery.text: Zimbardo showed that hooded participants gave stronger shocks than identifiable ones. Anonymity releases inhibition.

twist.text: Online anonymity produces the same effect. Trolling, harassment, and cruelty spike when identity is hidden.

climax.text: Deindividuation isn't about bad people. It's about situations that strip away the self-awareness that keeps us civil.

punchline.text: Hide the face and the conscience dims with it.

quiz.question: What is deindividuation?
options: Loss of self-awareness and personal responsibility in anonymity
A technique for building team identity
